page.title: 01Ardskenish Peninsula
page.content: An area of marram grass and machair including a portion of the islands 200 year old natural golf course-uninhabited now, but with an old farmhouse used for holidays. Area includes Traigh nam Bare, where St. Columba first landed on his mission to Scotland. Ardskenish provides good grazing but complete absence of trees leaves dunes and rocks to provide only shelter. Breeding ground of grey Atlantic Seal, and a thriving otter population; geese and wildfoul plentiful in winter, said to be delicious. Remnants of a 15@ Chapel, a standing stone of Bronze Age, also "Lazy Beds" - only remnants of a substantial population here in the mid - eighteenth century.
